div.sent: What is Christmas?
Every religion has some special festivals.
The Christian religion also has some big festivals.
Among them the Christmas is the most joyful festival.
In Christmas we enjoy a lot together.
But many of us do not know the real meaning of Christmas.
Let us now see what Christmas is all about.
Christmas is the birthday of Jesus Christ, the Saviour.
Every year on the 25th of December, this day is celebrated.
Millions of Christians celebrate the Christmas Day throughout the world.
This day is celebrated very colourfully.
The Saviour, Jesus Christ came down to this earth to save human kind.
He saved people from all their sins.
People had to wait for him for years.
He saved every person of the world.
That is why his birthday is a very joyful event.
Several incidents had happened at the time when Jesus Christ was born.
Let us learn some of them.
One day Caesar, the emperor of Rome issued an order.
It said that the population of his empire was to be counted.
So he ordered everyone to get to their birthplaces.
There they should enlist their names.

He worked at Tuital, Tumilia, Laksmibazar, Shrimangal, Baluchara, Golla Christian village and Bandura Seminary.
Golla Christian village was his last place of work.
Father Evens often helped the freedom fighters.
He advised, consoled and encouraged them as and when they needed.
The Pakistani Army came to know about Father Evens services towards the freedom fighters.
On every Saturday Father Evens used to go to the village named Baxanagar.
There he offered the Communion.
On that day too he was going to that village by a boat.
On the way, there was a camp of the Pakistani Soldiers.
They were on guard.
They stopped Father Evans.
They asked him to come to their camp.
So he followed them.
At the camp they were very rude to him and spoke to the Father angrily.
He suffered immense pain and soon he died.
It was Saturday, the 13th November The soldiers threw him in the river.
His dead body was found after two days.
The people of the Christian village brought his dead body.
People were very sad.
Because he was a very good man and he loved everybody.
However, Father Evans was buried in a graveyard of Golla Christian village.
He sacrificed his life for the liberation of Bangladesh.
So, Father Evans is a Shahid freedom fighter.
Birth and Boyhood of Subhas Biswas: Khaliskhali is a village in the district of Gopalgang.
It is situated on the bank of the river Madhumati.
Shahid Subhas was born in this beautiful village.
Keshablal Biswas was his father.
Subhas was from an ideal baptised family.
He was very attentive to his studies from his early life.
He obeyed his parents and so he was loved and cared by them very dearly.
He passed the SSC examination with good results.
But the financial condition of his family was not so good.
So he had to be admitted in a Baptised Mission Technical school at Faridpur.
The war of liberation started in the country form March, 1971.
A large number of our people left their homes and took shelter in India.
There the youth of our country received training and returned with arms in their hands.
Shahid Subhas also received training with his friends in India.
He returned to Gopalgainj with an LMG in his hand after the training.
As he returned to Bangladesh, he joined a commando troop.
His troop fought with the Pakistani soldiers at different places in Gopalganj district.
One day they planned to attack a Pak army camp at Gopalganj.
But they could not fight with the Pakistani solders for a long time.
As a result, they had to fall back.
But our brave fighters did not lose heart.
They planned another attack with more fighters and weapons.They collected some more fighters and weapons.
They were divided in four groups.
A fierce fighting started between our brave fighters and the Pakistani soldiers.
At one stage, the Pakistani launch carrying their soldiers sunk into the river.
Both the sides were fighting fiercely.
Many fighters of both the sides fell dead.
Many of them were injured.
The freedom fighters could not resist the regular Pakistani army with modern weapons.
They had to retreat.
While retreating they were crawling towards a paddy field.
Just then a bullet hit one of the legs of shahid Subhas.
A little later another bullet hit his head.
As a result, Subhas died within a very short time.
We pay deep respect and honour to the martyrs in our liberation war.
